content: >http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/africa/7992286.stm Time for a updated remake of Beau Geste? A 'deranged' member of the FFL posted to eastern Chad as part of an international refugee protection force was captured by Chadian gendarmes to-day after he fled the shooting of 2 fellow legionnaires. He also shot a member of the Togolese AF and a Chadian farmer. He fled on a stolen horse, heading for Sudan but was captured exhausted and hungry at a water hole en route. What triggered the 'fit of madness' is not known, as according to enlistment records, he wasn't crazy when he joined the Legion. This message has been edited. content: I think that the incident mentioned in the initial post is probably just the tip of the iceberg as far as what I believe you lot used to call "fragging" goes in Russia. BBC Newsnight did a series of reports on the modernisation of the Russian forces and one of the reasons mentioned for the move towards professional "contractnik" soldiers was that discipline in action had been poor in recent conflicts.
